snippet: China said it would permit banks to set their own exchange rates for the renminbi against the dollar in deals with clients, in a step to relax controls to make the currency more market-driven.
abstract: China says it will permit banks to set their own exchange rates for the renminbi against the dollar in deals with clients, in a step to relax controls to make the currency more market-driven.
lead_paragraph: China said it would permit banks to set their own exchange rates for the renminbi against the dollar in deals with clients, in a step to relax controls to make the currency more market-driven.

headline.main: China Relaxes Controls Over Exchange Rates
headline.print_headline: China Relaxes Controls Over Exchange Rates
